Authors:
Masahiro Suzuki, Hisayoshi Nozaki, Ryuta Terada, Taiju
Kitayama, Tetsuo Hashimoto, Makoto Yoshizaki
Title:
Morphology and molecular relationships of Leptofauchea
leptophylla comb. nov. (Rhodymeniales, Rhodophyta) from Japan
Keywords:
Faucheaceae, Gloiocladia leptophylla, Japan, Leptofauchea
leptophylla comb. nov., LSU rRNA, Rhodophyta
Abstract:
Detailed morphological studies and molecular analyses
based on nuclear-encoded large subunit ribosomal RNA (LSU rRNA) gene
sequences were undertaken on Gloiocladia leptophylla, a poorly known
species from Japan. Both newly collected samples and the holotype were
examined. Herein we describe for the first time the structure of
tetrasporangial nemathecia, decussately dividing tetrasporangia and male
gametophytes. We show that this species has a thin cortex, decussately
divided tetrasporangia formed in nemathecia and a tela arachnoidea
(network of inner pericarp filaments surrounding mature
carposporophytes), as in the genus Leptofauchea. LSU rRNA analyses
resolved G. leptophylla in the Faucheaceae (in which it was robustly
separated from Gloiocladia), forming a well-supported clade with five
other species of Leptofauchea and two species of Webervanbossea. We
therefore propose the new combination Leptofauchea leptophylla comb.
nov. Iridescence in water, a distinct short stipe and a medulla composed
of three to four cell layers are conspicuous diagnostic characters of L.
leptophylla within the genus.
